content:
When I setup GitHub repo for collaboration of Simp Chinese translation, I mistakenly set the repo to public for about two hours, and @Charles Lew forked the repo and it kept there for an extra hour. I have since switched the repo to private, and @Charles Lew has also taken down the fork.
The exposed results contain all email addresses history, which I forgot to strip out before pushing to GitHub, but has stripped now.
There is no evidence that anyone else has noticed and downloaded the data, but I think it's better to report here for your information. Sorry for the mistake.
Thanks for letting us know, @Xidorn Quan
